member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Secured.SRadioButtonList
member.summary: A secured, operation aware version of the RadioButtonList control
member.remarks:
Secured controls can be used to make interface elements aware of whether or not a user has access to a particular operation assigned to the control
If the user does not have access to the operation(s) assigned to the control, the control can be set to render differently (or not at all) to prevent the user from using the control to perform the secured operation
In addition, events normally raised by the control will not be raised if the control detects that the access check has failed. This prevents users from "spoofing" access by simulating a postback.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.MetaControls.Attributes.ListBoxMetaControlAttribute
member.summary: An attribute used to declare the need for a preference or setting to be displayed as a ListBox
member.remarks:
This attribute can be applied to either a portlet or an application (a class that inherits from PortalApplicationBase).
It will be used by the framework to automatically generate the appropriate preferences or settings overlay that allows the user to enter the data for that preference or setting using the control specified.
This information can then be retrieved by using the various preference and settings domain objects in the framework. They can also be accessed by using the Preferences or Settings property of the PortletBase and PortalApplicationBase classes.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile
member.summary: ConfigFile reads and writes the contents of a VAM.config file. It maintains the items read in its properties.

remarks.para: Use the Read method to read. It has a merge parameter which can merge one file's lists with another. Merging involves adding, replacing, and deleting.
Developers should not expect to subclass this.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.cVAMConfigFileName
member.summary: The file name for the VAM.config file.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.cVAMCustomConfileFileName
member.summary: The file name for the custom.VAM.config file.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. No parameters.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.fLastFileCheck
member.summary: fLastFileCheck is a TickCount for when the file was last loaded. Used to avoid testing the file datetime stamp every time Globals.Config is accessed because that will happen numerous times in one pass through the control list. Instead, we assume the user cannot change the Custom.VAM.config file within 5 seconds of running through the controls.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.ReadFilesIfChanged(System.String)
member.summary: ReadFilesIfChanged sees if custom.VAM.config has changed. If so, it rereads both files. Does nothing if fHasVAMConfigB or fHasCustomVAMConfig are false. Does nothing if its been called within the last 5 seconds. Returns true if the files were read. False if not.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.ReadAllFiles(System.String)
member.summary: ReadAllFiles reads the VAM.config and, if present, merges the Custom.VAM.Config file with it. It should be called when the ConfigFile class is first created. If VAM.Config is not found or anything is invalid about the format of either file, expect exceptions.
member.param: The file path to the folder containing these files.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.ReadRegEx(System.Xml.XmlTextReader)
member.summary: ReadRegEx reads the RegExPattern tags and fills in the RegExPatterns list. pReader must be positioned at the <RegExPatterns> node.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.GetTypeAttribute(System.Xml.XmlTextReader,System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: GetTypeAttribute retrieves the type= attribute at the current pReader position. It converts the string into a real type and returns it. It throws exceptions if type attribute is missing, cannot be converted into a type, and if it doesn't match pBaseType or its children.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.ReadNamedObjects(System.Xml.XmlTextReader,Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.CollectionsLibrary.NameObjectCollection,System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: ReadNamedObjects handles translating elements whose pattern is: <tag name="name" [enabled=true|false] type="fullname or qualifiedassemblyname"> <property name="property name">value</property> </tag> This supports DataTypes, ErrorFormatters, and Conditions. It creates an instance of the requested type, validates the type against pBaseType and assigns any property found in the property tags list using a TypeConverter to translate the string.
member.param: The source of XML.
The hashtable where elements are added, replaced or removed.
The type all objects must be.
The tag name that begins each row. When there no longer are these tags, exit.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.ReadProperties(System.Xml.XmlTextReader,System.Object,System.Type)
member.summary: ReadProperties goes through a list of <property> tags. For each, it uses the property's TypeConverter to convert from string to the correct datatype and Reflection to assign the value to the property. This tag has a name attribute for the property name and a value attribute for the property value. If it encounters an <object> tag, that tag starts a nested object which contains its own <property> tags, calling this method recursively. The <object> tag includes the name attribute for the property name and type= gives the class to instantiate. The class is only created if the property is not read only. If type= is omitted, it uses the current instance. Assembly= gives the assembly. Its only used when type= is defined and is required in that case.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.ReadNameValueCollection(System.Xml.XmlTextReader,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: ReadNameValueCollection goes through a list of <add> tags. Each must have two attributes: name and value. These are converted into entries of a NameValueCollection

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.ReadControlHookupMethods(System.Xml.XmlTextReader)
member.summary: ReadControlHookupMethods reads the ControlHookupMethod tags and fills in the ControlHookupMethods list. pReader must be positioned at the <ControlHookupMethod> node.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.ReadGlobalProperties(System.Xml.XmlTextReader)
member.summary:
ReadGlobalProperties reads the GlobalProperties section. It is a list of:
It applies the properties to the static properties of the Globals class. It uses ReadProperties to do this.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.ApplyUserDefinedNames
member.summary: ApplyUserDefinedNames goes through some of the collections and copies the name (key) from the NameValueCollection to the Name property on that collection. This allows the user to add custom versions of the objects, where the name and properties differ from the object's defaults. Affects: Conditions, ErrorFormatters, and DataTypes

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.RegExPatterns
member.summary: RegExPatterns is a collection of patterns used by the RegularExpressionCondition. The list is shown in the RegularExpressionTypeEditor so the user can pick one while setting up the condition. The collection is a NameValueCollection. The name is the Name attribute of the <RegExPattern name=""> tag. The value is the Pattern string.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.DataTypes
member.summary: DataTypes is a collection of VAMTypeConverter instances. The Hashtable's name attribute is the name attribute of <DataType name="">. The value attribute is the VAMTypeConverter instance.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.ThirdPartyControlDataTypes
member.summary: ThirdPartyControlDataTypes contains a subset of the same objects found in DataTypes. These objects each have VAMTypeConverter.SupportsThirdPartyControl set to true. This list is used by ControlConnection.IsValidControl to find a match to a control. All VAMTypeConverters in this list must have SupportsThirdPartyControl=true and override TestThirdPartyControl() and GetControlValue().

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.ErrorFormatters
member.summary: ErrorFormatters is a collection of BaseErrorFormatter instances. The Hashtable's name attribute is the name attribute of <ErrorFormatter name="">. The value attribute is the BaseErrorFormatter subclass instance.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.Conditions
member.summary: Conditions is a collection of BaseCondition instances. The Hashtable's name attribute is the name attribute of <Condition name="">. The value attribute is the BaseCondition instance.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.ControlHookupMethods
member.summary:
ControlHookupMethods is a collection that matches control types to their optional client-side Control Hookup method. The client side attaches the control's onchange or onclick event handler using VAM_HookupControl. That function must be passed the actual field to hookup or a Control Hookup Method which passes specific subcontrols to VAM_HookupControl.
Most control IDs reflect the actual control to pass to VAM_HookupControl. They are NOT added to this collection. Some, like CheckBoxLists and RadioButtonLists, contain subcontrols and are registered here. To add a control, call AddControlHookupMethod. To find a control, call FindControlHookupMethod. Default controls are installed in CreateDefaultControlHookupMethods. Web sites that support other hookup methods, should register them with AddControlHookupMethod during the Application_Start method. These methods are assigned to the client-side Condition object's HUCtrlFnc method.
Method description: Internally, this method should identify the control IDs that need an onchange or onclick event and call VAM_HookupControl again, with the control ID and the pCond parameter = null. Parameters: Cond object - contains ID(s) to translate into subcontrols. Action object - to be passed into VAM_HookupControl Main control ID (string) - the ID assigned by the user to the control. This ID must be converted into the subcontrol's ID, usually by adding a fixed string like ID + "_Button" Returns: Nothing

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFile.CustomVAMDateTime
member.summary: FileDateTime is the datetime stamp on the custom.VAM.Config file when it was last read. The file is re-read when the datetime stamp on the file changes. Initially, this is DateTime.MinValue.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.NamedConditionsCollection
member.remarks: NamedConditionsCollection is a collection of BaseCondition objects used by ConfigFile for the Conditions property. It keeps a name, which is the type name, and is sorted by the name.

remarks.para: NameObjectCollection subclasses NameObjectCollectionBase to do what Microsoft should have done all along: make it instantiatable with any object (like ArrayList). It still keeps keys in alphabetic order (case insensitive).
Subclasses can override ValidateType to reject undesired objects.
You can retrieve this class with documentation and sort at http://www.peterblum.com/CollectionsLibrary/AutoSortArrayList.aspx.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFileEditor
member.remarks: ConfigFileEditor is used by UITypeEditors to read and write the custom.VAM.config file. After reading, call various methods to modify the XmlDocuments representing custom.VAM.config then call the SaveCustomFile method.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFileEditor.fMainLoadErrorMsg
member.summary: These allow us to capture the exceptions in ReadFiles without displaying them right away. When functions call CheckValidFiles, if either isn't empty, it throws an exception with these errors.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFileEditor.ReadFiles
member.summary: ReadFiles creates new MainConfigDocument and CustomConfigDocuments. It uses Globals.ConfigFilePath for the file path. If it cannot load one of the files, it leaves the property null. This method must be called before using any other method. It always reloads CustomConfigDocuments but only loads MainConfigDocument once because the user doesn't edit MainConfigDocument.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFileEditor.CheckValidFiles
member.summary: CheckValidFiles throws an exception built from fMainLoadErrorMsg and fCustomLoadErrorMsg if either has text.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFileEditor.SaveCustomFile
member.summary: SaveCustomFile writes fCustomConfigDocument and refreshes Globals.ConfigFile

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFileEditor.DeleteNode(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: DeleteNode removes an item identified by the pNode. However, it may not delete the actual node. If the node exists in fMainConfigDocument, a node in fCustomConfigDocument is created or modified to read <nodename name="" enabled=false />. This effectively hides the option. If the node does not exist in fMainConfigDocument, remove the node in fCustomConfigDocument

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFileEditor.FindChildWithName(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.String)
member.summary: Searches the immediate children of pNode for an attribute "name" = pName. Returns that node or null.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFileEditor.RestoreToDefault(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: RestoreToDefault removes a node in fCustomConfigDocument, exposing the original in fMainConfigDocument.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFileEditor.ModifyNameValueNode(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adds or updates a node in the tree at pNode. This is designed for NameValueCollection areas of the config file that use <Add name=pName value=pValue /> If pName is already a name attribute, its value is modified and Enabled is removed (to show it) Otherwise it adds a new node.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFileEditor.ModifyNamePropertiesNode(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: ModifyNamePropertiesNode adds or updates a Name/property node group. The group is like this: <pNode> <pElementName name=pAttributeName> <Property name=propertyname1 value=propertyvalue1 /> <object name=propertyname1 [type=objectype assembly=assemblyname] > <Property name="propertyname" value=propertyvalue" /> </object> </pElementName> </pNode> Pass in an object in pValue. Its properties that are BrowsableAttribute(true) are all added to the property list. If the node already exists, the existing properties are first deleted before the new ones are assigned. It always writes every property instead of skipping those that match DefaultValueAttribute.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFileEditor.WritePropertyNodes(System.Xml.XmlNode,System.Object)
member.summary: WritePropertyNodes adds child nodes to pParentNode given the browsable, public, non-static properties of pInstance. Recursive.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFileEditor.IsOverridden(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: IsOverridden returns true when pNode has an entry in fMainConfigDocument and fCustomConfigDocument (where enabled <> false). Use it to enable an RestoreToDefault button.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConfigFileEditor.PrepNodePath(System.String)
member.summary: PrepNodePath takes a short section path ("/DataTypes/DataType") and puts it into a complete path ("/Configuration/DataTypes/DataType")

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter
member.summary: BaseErrorFormatter provides the HTML and JavaScript to the class for displaying the error message.

remarks.para: The actual format of displaying a validators error can have numerous looks.

The validator control uses this class to write the actual HTML into the page. Its job is to add controls to the ValidatorControls child list, to add JavaScript to the page, and to provide properties to the client-side representation of the ValidatorAction object that will be used by client-side versions of the ErrorFormatter classes.
See the Developer's Guide for extensive documentation.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.Clone
member.summary: Creates a duplicate instance of this object. Implements

1. Create an instance of the class
2. Call Copy()
3. Return the instance

member.returns: New instance of this object with the same property values.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.Copy(Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter)
member.summary: Copy transfers the properties from pSource to this instance.

value.para: >Subclasses should call their ancestor and support each property they introduce.

If you omit copying property, there will be side effects when the user uses the Properties Editor. The UITypeEditor for ErrorFormatters clones the ErrorFormatter and saves the clone. Any property not included in this method will lose its value.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.CompareTo(System.Object)

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.AddControls(System.Web.UI.Control,System.Boolean,Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseValidatorAction)
member.summary: Creates the HTML for the error message.

remarks.para: Called by the BaseValidatorAction.AddToPage method during OnPreRender.
It creates an enclosing tag for the error message and lets the ancestor fill in the body. All elements are added as child controls to the control passed in.
The enclosing tag has the following attributes assigned:

item.description: Tag name comes from .
ID= attribute is from .
Style= attribute is from the Display rule forming visibility and display parameters. In addition the has its values assigned.
Class= attribute is from .
Title= attribute is from .
The property assigns all of its contents as name and value pairs into the enclosing tag.

remarks.para: If there is a gap defined, it is created with and assigned after the enclosing tag so its visibility changes.
The inner HTML contents are defined by the subclass when this calls .
Does nothing when the Display property is None.

member.param: Add your controls to this pControl.Controls collection.
When true, the error message is visible (validator error is already showing)
The ValidatorAction instance that owns this.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.AddControlsBody(System.Web.UI.Control,Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseValidatorAction,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Override to provide the HTML that appears inside the enclosing tags innerText. It defines the actual look of the error message. It does not handle visibility.

remarks.para: Your code should build a containing HTML element, such as a SPAN tag, that has a unique ID which you will use to uniquely find the element on the client-side. Then your client-side function can call VAM_GetById() to get the control and assign the runtime error message.

The ParentClientID parameter is the unique ID of pControl. Your ID should add an extension to it, like ParentClientID + "_txt". Your client side code will have access to the ParentClientID in the ErrFldID property.
See the Developer's Guide for an example.

member.param: Add your controls to the Controls collection of this control.

Use BaseValidatorAction.GetErrorMessage to get the current error message. The error message should be replaceable in your client-side representation of this function by knowing the ID to the containing tag that you create.
Indicates if the message should be shown or not.
The ID of the enclosing control.
The ClientID of the enclosing control. Your child controls will use this to refer to the actual element that holds the error message so it can be updated on the client-side.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.GetGap(System.Int32,Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.GapType)
member.summary: GetGap returns a HTML string representing a gap or space based on the parameters passed.

remarks.para: When pGapType is Pixel, it forms an tag that uses the URL to the file named "spacer.gif" in either the "~/VAM/Appearance" folder or the user defined path from the VAM_AppearanceVirtualPath key in web.config.

member.returns: The HTML for the gap or "" when pGapSize is 0.
member.param: The number of characters or pixels. Usually pass GapBefore.
The type of the gap. Usually pass GapBeforeType.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.DefineJavaScript(Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.VAMPage)
member.summary: DefineJavaScript creates whatever JavaScript that is used by this error formatter on the client-side. It should define JavaScript functions or load a file.

remarks.para: It is passed the current VAMPage class which has two methods that make registration easy:
- Call VAMPage.IsScriptBlockRegistered before registering to determine if the script was written by another instance of this class.
- If its not registered, call VAMPage.RegisterScriptBlock or VAMPage.RegisterScriptFile.

member.param: Current VAMPage object.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.DefineProperties(Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseAction,System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Adds properties to the client-side representation for the ValidatorAction object.

remarks.para: Use the following support methods on the Action parameter to insert a property or method into the client-side VAM object:

item.description: for integers, strings, booleans, and doubles.
for method names.
for converting a control reference into its ClientID.
for using JavaScript code to create the value such as 'new Date()'.

remarks.para: Commas a required before each property. This is done automatically with all of the above Register methods. Otherwise, you must call pAction. before adding your text to the stringbuilder.
Here are the properties added by this class:

item.description: FormatterFunctionName.
fClientID.
Base on the Display property: 0 = none, 1 = static, 2 = dynamic.
BlinkAllowed
BlinkCssClass
BlinkFunctionName

member.param: The instance that supplies its properties to the client-side object. It also has the and properties for use in this method.
Append your properties to this stringbuilder.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.AddDesignModeControls(System.Web.UI.Control,Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseValidatorAction)
member.summary: AddDesignModeControls builds the HTML for the ErrorFormatter for design mode.

remarks.para: The design mode representation attempts to show a WYSIWYG representation of the control. In addition, if there are any required parameters that are not assigned, they are added to the end.
This method forms an enclosing <span> tag with style and class attributes assigned. It calls to allow the subclass to supply the WYSIWYG formatting.

If there are any missing but required properties, they are built into a string like this "[" + control.ID + [property descriptions] + "]". It first calls the Action.Condition. method to get a description of any errors on the Condition object. Then it sees if the ErrorMessage is blank (after using the String Lookup System on the ErrorMessageLookupID.)
When Display equals 'None', it shows "[ID Display=None]".

member.param: Add controls to the Controls collection of this parameter.
Supplies the current Action object and its condition to supply information used for formatting.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.AddDesignModeControlsBody(System.Web.UI.Control,Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseValidatorAction)
member.summary: AddDesignModeControls fills in the children of pControl with what shows inside the enclosing tag while in design mode.
member.param: Add controls to the Controls collection of this parameter.
Supplies the current Action object and its condition to supply information used for formatting.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.GetLookedUpToolTip
member.summary: Uses the String Lookup System to convert ToolTip and ToolTipLookupID into the actual tooltip text.
member.remarks: Returns fLookedupToolTip. If fLookedupToolTip == null, it calls StringLookup.StringIDLookup with ToolTipLookupID first.
member.returns: The tooltip text.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.Name
member.summary: Name gives a human readable name/identifier to the class.

value.para: Globals.ErrorFormatters maintains a list of predefined ErrorFormatters loaded from the config files or added in the Application_Start method. The user sees the name for an ErrorFormatter in the UITypeEditor for the BaseAnyValidator.ErrorFormatter property. At runtime, the BaseValidationAction searches Globals.ErrorFormatters for a match.

Users are allowed to create ErrorFormatter templates within the custom.VAM.config file using an existing ErrorFormatter class with non-default property assignments and assigning this property to a unique name.
This property is not visible in the Properties Editor but it is written into the ASP.NET representation of the control.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.Display
member.summary: Display determines how to show the ErrorMessage.

item.description: Never shows. Use when you only want the message in the SummaryValidator or to let other validation rules indicate the error (such as alert or flashing the field with the error.)
The field always takes up space on the page when invisible. Uses the style display:block and visibility to toggle.
The field doesnt take up space on the page when invisible. Uses the style display to toggle.

value.para: It defaults to Static.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.ControlStyle
member.summary: ControlStyle provides the elements of a Style object.

value.para: Provides font, color, border, and sizing style attributes to the element tag that encloses the error formatter's HTML.
The CssClass property contained in this object can establish all of these style attributes through a style sheet. It defaults to "VAMErrorText."
Most of the other style properties in this class simply expose this object's properties because this property is not shown in the Property Editor.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the error message.

value.para: Stores its value in ControlStyle.BorderColor.
It defaults to Color.Empty.

It defaults to "VAMErrorText". That name is declared in the VAMStyleSheet.css file supplied with VAM. Pages must either declare a <LINK> to VAMStyleSheet.css or assign this property to a style sheet class name declared on the page.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.Attributes
member.summary: Attributes is a collection of arbitrary attributes (for rendering only) that do not correspond to other properties on this class.

value.para: It's values are assigned to the enclosing tag of the error message.
For example, use this to add the attribute "disabled=true" to the HTML tag containing the error message.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.ToolTip
member.summary: ToolTip adds a tooltip to the error message.
member.value: Defaults to "".

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.ToolTipLookupID
member.summary: ToolTipLookupID provides an alternative to ToolTip. When used, the error message is looked up from another source, such as a resource file or database to use as the ToolTip.

value.para: This allows you to define a common set of error messages so the programmer doesn't uniquely define them each time. It also provides localization based on the current culture.
To use it, assign a key string that represents the ToolTip that you want. This key will be used to search your data source for the correct string.
When you are using the default Resource Manager system of VAM, it looks at the Name field of the ResX file for a match. The Value field of that row is returned.
If no match is found OR this is blank, ToolTip will be used.
This property uses the StringGroup of StringLookup.cMiscGroupName.
It defaults to "".
converts this into the desired string.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.GapBefore
member.summary: GapBefore is used to place a gap to the left of the error, when it is shown.

value.para: The gap can be in characters, using   or pixels using a hidden graphic.
The pixel gap is formed by stretching the 1x1 pixel graphic (visibility:hidden). So this is the number of pixels to stretch the image. The image is from the Appearance folder, spacer.gif.
It defaults to 0 because if it was non-zero by default, anything not positioned to the right of a field would appear shifted. So make the user set it to form the gap.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.GapBeforeType
member.summary: GapBeforeType determines how is formatted.
member.value: Defaults to GapType.Character.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.BlinkAllowed
member.summary: BlinkAllowed enables the error message text or image to blink to catch the user's attention based on VAMPage.BlinkOnChange and VAMPage.BlinkOnSubmit.

value.para: When true, blinking is allowed.
It defaults to true.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.BlinkCssClass
member.summary: BlinkCssClass is a style sheet class name for the blinked state of the error message object.

value.para: When blinking, the client side switches the Class attribute on the enclosing tag of the error message between this class and its original value.
If this is blank, the client side switches between transparent text and its original text.

It defaults to "VAMBlinkText". That name is declared in the VAMStyleSheet.css file supplied with VAM. Pages must either declare a <LINK> to VAMStyleSheet.css or assign this property to a style sheet class name declared on the page.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.BlinkFunctionName
member.summary: BlinkFunctionName defines the client-side Blink Function name which is called to toggle the blinking.

value.para: This property allows an ErrorFormatter to provide a substituate client side blink function.
It defaults to "VAM_Blink".
Assigned to the client-side representation of the validator action object in the Blink property
See the Developer's Guide for details and example on the client-side Blink Function.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.FormatterFunctionName
member.summary: FormatterFunctionName defines the client-side Error Formatter Function name which is called to change the attributes of the error message information.

value.para: Each ErrorFormatter subclass should supply its own Error Formatter function to show and hide the error message and other HTML.
It defaults to "".
See the Developer's Guide for details and example on the client-side Error Formatter Function.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.CanFormatTokens
member.summary: CanFormatTokens determines if this class supports formatting on tokens (Action.ReplaceMessageToken).

value.para: ErrorMessages can contain tokens, like "{TEXTVALUE}" and "{COUNT}". The declares properties that provide style sheet class names to each of the three types of tokens: property, runtime, and other. The method calls this to determine of those style sheet class names should be added into the ErrorMessage or not. If this returns true, ReplaceMessageToken embeds the token like this: token.
When false, it does not embed the token into the <span> tag.
ErrorFormatters that support HTML in their error messages should override this to return true.
Returns false by default.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseErrorFormatter.EnclosingTagName
member.summary: EnclosingTagName supplies the tag that encloses the error formatter.

value.para: It defaults to "span".
This enclosing tag is supplied all of the style properties and values from Attributes.
Do not enclose the TagName in < or > characters.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ValidatorDisplay
member.summary: ValidatorDisplay is the same concept as Microsoft's definition for this type. It determines how the error message is shown on the page.
member.remarks: It is duplicated in case Microsoft changes their enumerated type (adds other cases) so we don't break.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ValidatorDisplay.None
member.summary: The validation message is never displayed inline.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ValidatorDisplay.Static
member.summary: Space for the validation message is allocated in the page layout.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ValidatorDisplay.Dynamic
member.summary: Space for the validation message is dynamically added to the page if validation fails.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ValidationEvents
member.summary: ValidationEvents is used by the BaseValidatorAction.EventsThatValidate property to determine what events fire the validator: OnChange OnSubmit

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ValidationEvents.All
member.summary: It runs on both onchange and onsubmit events. This is the traditional setup.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ValidationEvents.OnSubmit
member.summary: Runs only onsubmit. Turns off validation on field changes but demands validation when the page is submitted.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ValidationEvents.OnChange
member.summary: Runs only onchange. Turns off validation when submitting. This state is effectively a warning and turns off server side validation as well. A warning is the ability to show an error message without stopping the user.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.GapType
member.summary: GapType determines how to format a gap, using Characters or pixels. It is used with BaseErrorFormatter.GapBeforeType and TextErrorFormatter.GapAfterImageType.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.GapType.Character
member.summary: Gap uses the text " " for each unit of separation.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.GapType.Pixel
member.summary: Gap uses an image that is stretched to by a number of pixels.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.TokenType
member.summary: TokenType determines the type of token. It is used by BaseValidatorAction.ReplaceMessageToken.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.TokenType.Label
member.summary: Label is for {LABEL} and {LABEL#} tokens.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.TokenType.Property
member.summary: Property is for properties on the control.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.TokenType.Runtime
member.summary: Runtime is for values determined at runtime, usually on the client side.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.TokenType.Other
member.summary: Other is for any other token such as singular:plural.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.TextErrorFormatter
member.summary: TextErrorFormatter places the ErrorMessage on the page as literal text.

remarks.para: This error formatter puts the error message directly on the page. It looks like the formatting supplied with Microsoft's validators. However, it is designed to separate any HTML formatting from the error message.
The and properties can enclose the error message in HTML or simply text.
The allows the user to include an image before the text.
See the Developer's Guide for and overview and subclassing strategy.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.TextErrorFormatter.AddControlsBody(System.Web.UI.Control,Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseValidatorAction,System.Boolean,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Builds several LiteralControls containing the optional HTMLBefore, option ImageURL, a <span> which contains the error message text, and HTMLAfter.

remarks.para: The error message is retrieved from the Action's GetErrorMessage method so that server side tokens and string lookup system conversion are applied. The error message is only inserted when the client-side is disabled or Display=Static. It adds for Display=Static only to insert the same space needed for the error message, which will be updated on the client side when first shown.
The <span> tag that encloses the error message has the ID= attribute set to pParentClientID + "_Txt". This allows the client-side code to locate the <span> tag and set the innerText.
HTMLBefore and HTMLAfter are converted through the string lookup system using and . They are only added if the converted string is not blank.
The image is added by calling .

member.param: Add child controls to this control.
This BaseValidatorAction is the owner of this error formatter. Use its GetErrorMessage method to get the error message.
When true, the error message should be shown. When false, it is hidden. The outer control actually does the showing and hiding.
The parent control ID in this Naming Container.
The parent control's ClientID. Use this to form a unique ID= attribute that can be looked up within JavaScript. Usually you add an extension to this string like "_txt".

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.TextErrorFormatter.AddDesignModeControlsBody(System.Web.UI.Control,Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseValidatorAction)
member.summary: Shows HTMLBefore, ImageURL, the error message (without token conversion), and HTMLAfter.

remarks.para: All strings are run through the String Lookup System to apply their LookupID property.

member.param: Add child controls to this control.
This BaseValidatorAction is the owner of this error formatter. Use it to get the ErrorMessage and ErrorMessageLookupID properties.

member.summary: AddLeadImage supports the property. It inserts an tag into the controls list.

remarks.para: The ImageUrl is the src= attribute. The ID= attribute is fClientID + "_Img". This ID is used by the client-side blinking code in the VAM_Blink function.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseImageErrorFormatter
member.summary: BaseImageErrorFormatter places an tag on the page and calls on a subclass to define a way to show the error message.

remarks.para: The property is used as the URL to the image.

When blinking, the enclosing <span> tag must remain visible so that the user can click on the spot of the image when the image is in its blinked state. Thus blinking is extended to show and hide the image itself using the visibility style. That preserves the space of the image so the user has a place to click upon.
The image gets the ClientID of the span tag PLUS "_Img":

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Secured.SLinkButton
member.summary: A secured, operation aware version of the LinkButton control
member.remarks:
Secured controls can be used to make interface elements aware of whether or not a user has access to a particular operation assigned to the control
If the user does not have access to the operation(s) assigned to the control, the control can be set to render differently (or not at all) to prevent the user from using the control to perform the secured operation
In addition, events normally raised by the control will not be raised if the control detects that the access check has failed. This prevents users from "spoofing" access by simulating a postback.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Secured.SImageButton
member.summary: A secured, operation aware version of the ImageButton control
member.remarks:
Secured controls can be used to make interface elements aware of whether or not a user has access to a particular operation assigned to the control
If the user does not have access to the operation(s) assigned to the control, the control can be set to render differently (or not at all) to prevent the user from using the control to perform the secured operation
In addition, events normally raised by the control will not be raised if the control detects that the access check has failed. This prevents users from "spoofing" access by simulating a postback.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseMultiCondition
member.summary: BaseMultiCondition defines a list of zero or more objects (including other MultiConditions).

remarks.para: Subclasses must define the EvaluateCondition method.
The property holds a collection Condition objects.

The property is set to false and hidden from the Properties Editor because it isn't used by this class. (Condition objects added to the Conditions collection have their own EvaluateOnClickOrChange properties which can be true.)
See the Developer's Guide for an overview.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCondition
member.summary: BaseCondition is the base class to all Conditions.

remarks.para: While Conditions eventually need to know about field IDs on the page that they are evaluating, this base class is too abstract for that. It introduces client and server side functions that define the concepts of evaluating a Condition.

The ancestor has already defined methods to hook up client-side code. The
property is the client-side evaluation function which returns the Condition's evaluation result. Subclasses should override EvalFunctionName.
Users can provide a substitute EvalFunctionName with .
See the Developer's Guide for details and examples.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCA
member.summary: BaseCA is the ancestor to all conditions and actions. It is an abstract class.

remarks.para: See the Developer's Guide for an extensive overview of this class and its subclasses.

member.summary: INamingObject helps objects consistantly name themselves and retrieve names of their parent objects in a tree.

remarks.para: It is designed to assist in exception handling so the user knows the exact element that has an invalid value.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.INamingObject.GetName

member.summary: PrepareBody is called within to handle the actual preparation. Subclasses often override it.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCA.DefineJavaScript(Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.VAMPage)
member.summary: DefineJavaScript creates whatever JavaScript that is used by this condition or action. It should define JavaScript functions or load a file.

remarks.para: It is passed the current VAMPage class which has two methods that make registration easy:
- Call VAMPage.IsScriptBlockRegistered before registering to determine if the script was written by another instance of this class.
- If its not registered, call VAMPage.RegisterScriptBlock or VAMPage.RegisterScriptFile.

member.param: Current VAMPage object.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCA.CreateClientSideObject(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: CreateClientSideObject builds the JavaScript for the client-side object that represents this server-side object.

remarks.para: It creates the outer structure of the object definition with Enabled, InitFnc and MainFnc properties. It calls to allow subclasses to add their own properties.

The string should use the Object Initializer format:
http://devedge.netscape.com/library/manuals/2000/javascript/1.5/guide/obj.html#1008302
{property1:value1, property2:value2,..., propertyN:valueN}

member.param: The stringbuilder to which the client-side representation of this object will be appended.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCA.RegisterMainFunction(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: RegisterMainFunction allows subclasses to define their client side main function.
member.remarks: BaseAction and BaseCondition each subclass this to define their own unique main function.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCA.fFirstProperty
member.summary: fFirstProperty is used by to avoid writing a comma at the beginning of the properties list.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCA.AddComma(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: AddComma should be called prior to every property being added to the client-side representation of the condition or action object through its method. It will add the comma unless its the first property (determined by ).
member.remarks: This method is called internally from , , , BaseCondition.RegisterComparer, BaseCondition.RegisterOperator, and . You only call it if you add text to the Stringbuilder within without using these other functions.
member.param: The representation of the client-side object. Add the comma to the end.

[,]PropertyName: 'ClientID'

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCA.DefineProperties(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: DefineProperties is called by to allow subclasses to extend the client-side VAM object with additional fields.

remarks.para: The client-side Initialization Function and Main Function usually need the properties defined on subclasses to operate. Use this method to add those properties.
Use the following support methods to insert a property or method into the client-side VAM object:

item.description: for integers, strings, booleans, and doubles.
for method names.
for converting a control reference into its ClientID.
for using JavaScript code to create the value such as 'new Date()'.

remarks.para: Commas a required before each property. This is done automatically with all of the above Register methods. Otherwise, you must call before adding your text to the stringbuilder.
BaseCA does nothing in this method.

member.param: Append your properties to this stringbuilder.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCA.ValidateProperties
member.summary: ValidateProperties is where the object should review its user-set properties and throw an Exception when they are illegal.

remarks.para: Called from BaseAction.PrepareBody.
BaseCA does nothing in this method.
VAM supplies the class for throwing exceptions. You can also throw .

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCA.CanEnableClientScript
member.summary: Determines if client-side scripts should be generated for this object.

remarks.para: This method only tests TrueBrowser.ReliableScripting. Subclasses may have reasons to disable it due to settings that don't make the javascript valid, such as a missing property, or introduce a property that lets the user disable scripting.

member.returns: True when scripting should be generated; false if not.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCA.GetName
member.summary: GetName returns a descriptive name for this object and any parents in the form: [Parentname].thisname. It goes through all Parents in the tree to build a complete name like this: RequiredTextValidator1.Enabler

member.summary: Determines if this condition or action object is used on the page or not. When true, its available for use.

value.para: Users can turn off an action or condition by setting this to false.
It defaults to true.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCA.InitFunctionName
member.summary: Gets the name of a JavaScript function used to initialize the client-side representation of this object.

value.para: When blank, there is no client-side initialization function to run.
If defined, it will be assigned as the InitFnc method in the client-side representation of this object.
Override this property to return your function name.

Use it to further setup this condition or action, possibly taking an immediate action. It should hook up any controls' onchange or onclick events using VAM_HookupControl() The Action version of this function differs from the Condition version.
Action:
It takes one parameter, the client-side VAM Action object. It returns nothing.

Use to establish properties including defaults from those not supplied because they are at their default values and we don't want to expand the size of the Javascript unnecessarily. See the Developer's Guide for details and example.
Condition:
It takes two parameters, the client-side VAM Condition object and client-side VAM Action object. It returns nothing.
Use to establish properties and call VAM_HookupControl() on each field that will fire the action onchange or onclick events. See the Developer's Guide for details and example.

member.name: F:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCondition.ServerCondition
member.summary: ServerCondition is an event handler that allows users to replace the built in EvaluateCondition() method with custom code.

value.para: Users can instantiate any of the non-base Condition classes and use it. The idea is to select one whose properties are useful to your condition. Often, the user writes very specific code that knows every condition in the code and doesn't need any user configuration settings on the property. They'd use CustomCondition, a child class of BaseCondition, because it lacks other properties.
While this event handler passes pArg as ConditionEventArgs, subclasses of BaseCondition may provide a subclass of ConditionEventArgs.

item.description: uses which provides references to the control and its textual value.
uses which provides references to both controls and their textual values.

value.para: When writing a ServerCondition function, access all public properties directly from the pSourceCondition parameter (after typecasting).
The task of this event handler is to set either the IsMatch or CannotEvaluate properties based on what is detected from fields on the page.

member.summary: GetVAMTypeConverter creates the used by this condition.

Any BaseCondition that implements IDataTypeProperty automatically creates a VAMTypeConverter here, using .
Classes that do not support IDataTypeProperty should subclass.
Return null when the class doesn't support VAMTypeConverters.
Does not get called when fVAMTypeConverter is already assigned.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCondition.Evaluate
member.summary: Evaluate is the master method to evaluating the condition.

remarks.para: It should be called after first checking . (It throws an exception if you call it when it can't eval.)
It calls or the then applies the NotCondition property to the result.

member.returns: True when the condition was successful or could not be evaluated. False when the condition failed.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCondition.EvaluateCondition
member.summary: Evaluates the condition using the properties of this class to determine the rules of evaluation.

remarks.para: This abstract method must be subclassed. It is called from when has not been assigned an event handler.
It returns one of these values:

item.description: 1 - success. Data on the page matches the requirements.
0 - failed. Data on the page fails to match the requirements.
-1 - cannot evaluate. A condition of a field does not permit evaluation. Common cases are a blank field (only RequiredTextCondition should evaluate this) and unable to convert a datatype.

remarks.para: Each Condition defines what causes a 1, 0 or -1 result. For example, the equivalent of a RequiredFieldValidator will determine if the associated text field is empty and return 1 when it is not.
Use the Owner property to determine the Page and NamingContainer to search for any controls.

member.returns: 1 = success; 0 = failure; -1 = cannot evaluate

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCondition.CanEvaluate
member.summary: CanEvaluate determines if the object is properly setup to support evaluation. It returns true if it can.

remarks.para: The method should only be called when this returns true.
This method should only evaluate static values, not the current value of a field.
Use the Owner property to determine the Page and NamingContainer to search for any controls.
When not subclassed, it returns the value of .

member.returns: True when the Evaluate() method can be run. False when it cannot.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCondition.Describe
member.summary: Describe builds a string that describes the condition for use with the design mode interface.

remarks.para: This string will appear in several places:

item.description: Properties Editor row for the Enabler property.
Properties Editor interface for the MultiCondition, describing each condition in the tree view.
Written into the ASP.NET code for the Enabler property (although its not used).

remarks.para: A description should only include the most relevant properties that determine how the condition is evaluated.
Most of the work is done by the method.
This method calls DescribeBody() to do most of the work. This class adds the NotCondition when its true like this:
If the condition implements IDataTypeProperty, it adds the datatype to the end like this: " [datatype]"

member.returns: A description of the properties that effect how the condition is evaluated.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCondition.DescribeBody
member.summary: DescribeBody is called by to allow subclasses to build the string that describes their condition.

remarks.para: This text should not handle the NotCondition or identify the datatype of IDataTypeProperty conditions because the Describe() method handles them.
It builds an English structure statement that includes only the properties involved in determining the condition. For example, "between 3 and 5" for RangeCondition.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCondition.GetDesignModeErrors
member.summary: GetDesignModeErrors is called by the BaseErrorFormatter in design mode to allow the condition to describe any properties that have erroreous values.

remarks.para: This information is shown in the design mode interface of the control so that the user knows there are errors in the setup very quickly. It should identify any properties that have problems which must be fixed to get the control to work.
Return "" when there are no problems. Otherwise give the property name "=" and problem. Always include a trailing space when a description is added.

member.returns: A string containing properties and values with significant errors or "" when there are no problems.

If this does not happen, design mode will have bugs where the properties will be lost after edits are made in the Properties Editor.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCondition.EvalWithOperator(Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ConditionOperator,System.Object,System.Object,System.Collections.IComparer)
member.summary: EvalWithOperator determines the result of a boolean expression. It returns a boolean result.

remarks.para: A boolean expression contains three elements: left value, operator, and right value. For example: 1 <> 2
Boolean expression comparisions are done throughout the various methods. This static method provides a standard way to compare two values, using the to determine the operator.

The values must be classes that support the interface or supply an instance. These interfaces allows for generic support of comparing two values. VAMTypeConverter.Comparer supplies the IComparer instance value so your EvaluateCondition method doesn't have to figure it out.
pLeftValue and pRightValue must be compatible datatypes for use with the IComparable interface to work.

member.param: Defines the operator between the left and right values.
The value to the left of the operator in the expression.
The value to the left of the operator in the expression.
An instance of an IComparer for more complex matching (like case insenstivity). If null, its not used.
member.returns: The result of the boolean expression.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCondition.GetControlTextValue(System.Web.UI.Control,System.Boolean)
member.summary: GetControlTextValue returns the data of a control as a string.

remarks.para: It supports controls that use the . If you pass a control that does not support this attribute, this method returns null.
The supported control all must have a textual representation for their data.
Microsoft's controls which support ValidationPropertyAttribute are: TextBox, HtmlInputText, HtmlTextArea, HtmlInputFile, ListBox, and DropDownList

member.param: The control whose data you want to retrieve.
When true, trim the lead and trailing spaces from the string before returning it.
member.returns: The data of the control. If the control does not support ValidationPropertyAttribute, it returns null.

member.returns: The PropertyDescriptor associated with the ValidationPropertyAttribute or null if not found.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCondition.OverrideClientSideEvaluation
member.summary: When set to a value other than 'No', the client-side evaluation function supplied by this class is replaced with one that has special properties to show and hide the error message regardless of the data on the page.

remarks.para: Useful when writing custom server side functions that don't have an equivalent client-side function. This gives a slight client-side behavior, including blinking the error message on postback and hiding it after edits.

When 'No', the property provides the client-side evaluation function. Otherwise, this property causes the to be set to "VAM_EvalAltCS" and the OCSMode property to be added to the client-side object for use by VAM_EvalAltCS.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.CountTrueConditions
member.summary: Evaluates the child conditions and determines if the number of those that evaluate as "success" is between a range specified by the and properties.

remarks.para: Useful in counting checkboxes scattered around a page.
Set up Conditions to be counted in the property. The Properties Editor for that property makes this easy. Each of the conditions is evaluated and compared to the values in the and properties.
See the User's Guide for an overview of using this condition.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.CountTrueConditions.EvaluateCondition
member.summary: Evaluates as "success" when the number of conditions in the property that evaluate as "success" themselves is between the and . Evaluates as "failed" when the number is outside the range. Evaluates as "cannot evaluate" when there are no child Conditions or all of them evaluate as "cannot evaluate".

remarks.para: It only counts the results of the immediate children Condition. Those children may be based on BaseMultiCondition and have children of their own, which only serve to determine if their parent evaluates as "success" or "failed".

member.returns: 1 when "success"; 0 when "failed"; -1 when "cannot evaluate"

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.RequiredTextCondition
member.summary: RequiredTextCondition determines if the ControlToEvaluate field that has a textual value is considered blank (matches the property). When its not blank, the condition evaluates as "success".

remarks.para: See the User's Guide for an overview of using this condition.
This condition supports any control with a as they all can return a textual value.
The user can define one or more values for an unassigned state using the property. UnassignedValues can be compared case sensitive or insensitive with the property.
Uses the property to determine if a blank field allows spaces or not. Ancestor defaults Trim to true.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseOneFieldCondition.GetVAMTypeConverter
member.summary: BaseOneFieldCondition can intelligently assign the VAMTypeConverter based on attributes of the ControlToEvaluate.

remarks.para: When this class implements , it does the following to create the VAMTypeConverter:

list.item: If the control implements , use the name returned from the control.

item.description: If the user defined name in the DataType property is found in and its VAMTypeConverter.SupportsThirdPartyControl is true, use it. This allows a control to support multiple DataTypes and the users selection determines which is used.
If the control is matched to an item in VAMTypeConverter.TestThirdPartyControl, use that VAMTypeConverter.
Otherwise call the ancestor.

member.returns: The VAMTypeConverter found or null.
member.exception: When the ControlToEvaluate is not found on the page.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.RequiredTextCondition.UnassignedValues
member.summary: UnassignedValues is the text representing the unassigned state. When the control's value matches this value, the condition evaluates as "failed".

value.para: Matching may be case sensistive or insensitive based on .

This string supports multiple items that reflect the unassigned state. They must be separated by a pipe (|). For example, a text box is unassigned when either blank or "Enter a value" is present. Use "|Enter a value". (The part prior to the pipe is an empty string.)
Lead and trailing spaces are removed on each item within the UnassignedValues.
It defaults to "".

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.RequiredTextCondition.UnassignedCaseInsensitive
member.summary: UnassignedCaseInsenstive determines if the property uses a case insensitive match or not.

value.para: When true, its case insensitive.
It defaults to true.

member.summary: Client-side evaluation function is named "VAM_EvalReqTextCond".

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.RequiredListCondition
member.summary: RequiredListCondition supports subclasses of : ListBox, DropDownList, RadioButtonList, and CheckBoxList. It also supports . The condition determines if these objects have a selection that differs from an unassigned state.

remarks.para: See the User's Guide for an overview of using this condition.
There is an property that allows the user to define an item that when selected is still the unassigned state. It defaults to 1 which indicates no selection is the unassigned state.
NOTE: CheckBoxLists do not support the UnassignedIndex property. They are unassigned by having no checkboxes marked.
ListBoxes with multiple selections are supported. The condition evaluates as "success" when any selected item matches the UnassignedIndex.

If you define a series of checkboxes or radio buttons without using CheckBoxList or RadioButtonList and want to know if there is any selection, use a with an AND operator and a associated with each checkbox/radiobutton.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ControlConnection
member.summary: ControlConnection defines a reference to a control on the page, either through its ID or a direct reference. It validates that the assigned control is valid for use with the class that uses the ControlConnection, such as checking the class of the control and if the control's ID property is assigned.

remarks.para: There are two properties which establish a link to a control on the page: and . When the user assigns to ControlID is defined, this system searches the Owner's naming container and all parent naming containers find the ID. If the ID is not within those containers, you can assign the object instance directly to the ControlInstance property. That doesn't care about naming containers.

This class provides methods to validate the control assigned and exception handling when an invalid control is used. In the ControlConnection class, it considers the following invalid: Control whose ID is blank, BaseValidator, FieldStateController, MultiFieldStateController, Literal, and LiteralControl. Override the method to change the validation rules.
There are several UITypeEditors subclassed from to use with controls that define new properties using ControlConnections.
See the Developer's Guide for an overview of this class and its subclasses.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ControlConnection.#ctor(System.Web.UI.Control,System.Boolean,System.String,Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.INamingObject)
member.summary: Constructor. This constructor is automatically assumed by BaseOneFieldCondition and BaseTwoFieldCondition for their ControlIDToEvaluate and SecondControlIDToEvaluate properties.
member.param: Control which owns the property that holds this class. It can be null only when you don't use the GetInstance method (or retrieve the ControlInstance property). This case is used by ControlConnectionTypeEditor to get to the IsValidControl method.
When false, exception is thrown when no control is defined and the user calls GetInstance().
The name of the property on pOwner which holds this class. Used in the default error message.
A reference to the owner object that implements INamingObject.

member.name: M:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.ControlConnection.GetInstance(System.Boolean)
member.summary: GetInstance returns the instance of a control associated with ControlInstance or ControlID.

remarks.para: If ControlInstance is null and ControlID is assigned, it searches the Owner's naming container and its parent naming containers to find a match for ControlID. It validates any control found, throwing exceptions when its not valid, not found or when AllowNoControl is false, ID is also blank.
It updates fControlInstance and uses that value on later calls.

member.returns: Reference to the control identified by ControlID or ControlInstance or null.
member.exception: When the control class isn't supported by .
When ControlID is assigned but cannot be found.
When AllowNoControl is false and no control was assigned.
member.param: When true, it returns null if no control is specified. When false, it throws an exception in this case.

member.summary: Evaluates as "success" when the value is within the range. Evaluates as "failed" when the value is out of range. Evaluates as "cannot evaluate" when the has blank text for data or cannot convert its text into the desired data type.

VAMTypeConverter.CSComparerFunction.

Maximum - will be converted to the Max property during the client-side Init function

member.summary: Minimum is a string representing the minimum value of the range.

value.para: If it is "", there is no minimum.
This string must be compatible with the defined by the subclass. (On the RangeCondition, see the property.) For example, if the data type is an integer, this value can only contain digits.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseRangeCondition.Maximum
member.summary: Maximum is a string representing the maximum value of the range.

value.para: If it is "", there is no maximum.
This string must be compatible with the defined by the subclass. (On the RangeCondition, see the property.) For example, if the data type is an integer, this value can only contain digits.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.RangeCondition
member.summary: RangeCondition compares the value of any text field to a range determined by minimum and maximum values.

remarks.para: Set the property to the control and the range with and properties. Set the property to determine the data type of ControlIDToEvaluate, Minimum and Maximum.
See the User's Guide for an overview of using this condition.
The base class, , does most of the work.
This class introduces the DataType property by implementing .

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.IDataTypeProperty
member.summary: IDataTypeProperty should be assigned to any or subclass that uses a DataType property. The DataType property gives a name of a VAMTypeConverter (specifically a match to VAMTypeConverter.Name property) and allows the Condition to convert from the Name to the VAMTypeConverter at runtime.

remarks.para: It is used by the BaseCondition subclasses to automatically set this property when attaching the ControlToEvaluate to a control that supports the interface.
remarks.code: if ((ControlToEvaluate is IGetDataTypeName) && (this is IDataTypeProperty)) ((IDataTypeProperty) this).DataType = ((IGetDataTypeName)ControlToEvaluate).GetDataType().Name;

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.IDataTypeProperty.DataType
member.summary: Allows the user to assign the name of a data type here. The name must match a VAMTypeConverter in the Globals.DataTypes collection.

remarks.para: Assign the UITypeEditor to your implementation of DataType to allow the user to pick from a list of data types.

without adding it to the custom.VAM.config or Globals.DataTypes collection.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseTwoFieldCondition.SecondControlIDToEvaluate
member.summary: Gets and sets the ID to the second control whose value will be evaluated.

value.para: This is ID property, not the ClientID or UniqueID. It will be translated into the ClientID at runtime.
If the control cannot be found in the current or any parent NamingContainer, an exception is thrown at runtime.
overrides this property when it is not null.

remarks.para: When you get or set, this property eventually calls to establish that the user has assigned a valid control class here.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseTwoFieldCondition.SecondControlToEvaluate
member.summary: Gets and sets a reference to a control whose value will be evaluated. It is an alternative to that allows the control to be anywhere on the page instead of the same naming container as the Owner control.

value.para: When assigned, it overrides any setting SecondControlIDToEvaluate.
This can be a reference to the control anywhere on the page, not just in the same naming container.
When you get or set, this property eventually calls to establish that the user has assigned a valid control class here.

member.exception: When the control class is not validated by the .

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseCompareToValueCondition.ValueToCompare
member.summary: ValueToCompare is a string representing the value to be compared.

value.para: The value is required. If it is blank, an exception will thrown at runtime.
This string must be compatible with the VAMTypeConverter used on this condition. For example, if the datatype is an integer, this value can only contain digits.
This value is the right side of the expression. The control's value is on the left side.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.RegexCondition
member.summary: RegexCondition compares a string from any field supporting to a Regex expression. If Regex returns a match, the condition evaluates as "success".

remarks.para: Set the property to the control and the expression with .
See the User's Guide for an overview of using this condition.

The regular expression must be compatible with both .Net and JavaScript. JavaScript's RegEx syntax is a subset of .Net so that description should be used. See:
http://devedge.netscape.com/library/manuals/2000/javascript/1.5/reference/regexp.html#1193136
One of the more powerful features of Regular expressions is the OR condition, using the | operator. For example, you can match US and internation phone number strings: (USRegEx)|(IntRegEx)

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.RegexCondition.Expression
member.summary: Expression is a Regular Expression that is valid for both JavaScript and .Net RegEx parsers.

value.para: This condition evaluates as "success" when the Regular Expression parser matches the control to this expression.
When left blank, the condition evaluates as "cannot evaluate".

The regular expression must be compatible with both .Net and JavaScript. JavaScript's RegEx syntax is a subset of .Net so that description should be used. See:
http://devedge.netscape.com/library/manuals/2000/javascript/1.5/reference/regexp.html#1193136
One of the more powerful features of Regular expressions is the OR condition, using the | operator. For example, you can match US and internation phone number strings: (USRegEx)|(IntRegEx)

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.RegexCondition.CaseInsensitive
member.summary: CaseInsenstive determines if the matching uses a case insensitive match or not.

value.para: When true, it is case insensitive.
Defaults to true.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.RegexCondition.Multiline
member.summary: Multiline changes the meaning of ^ and $ so they match at the beginning and end, respectively, of any line, and not just the beginning and end of the entire string.

value.para: It defaults to false.

Note:Many browsers do not support this option during client-side regular expression parsing. Only set this to true when you are certain your user's browsers will support it. Browsers found to support it include IE for Windows and Netscape 6+. IE for Mac and Netscape 4 definitely do not. Others have not been tested by PeterBlum.com.

member.summary: CanEvaluateNeedsExpressionAssigned determines if CanEvaluate requires Expression != "" to be true. Subclasses may set this to false.
member.value: This class returns true.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.CompareToStringsCondition
member.summary: CompareToStringsCondition compares the contents of a textbox to a list of strings. If it matches one of the strings, the condition succeeds.

remarks.para: Matching provides the property, which permits non-exact matches such as the string must be contained, start or end the item in the list.
This class is based on to use the regex parser to accomplish this. It builds an expression on that looks like this:
(ListItem1)|(ListItem2)|(ListItem3)|etc
When using MatchTextRule.Exact, ListItem = ^ListItem&
When using MatchTextRule.StartsWith, ListItem = ^ListItem
When using MatchTextRule.EndsWith, ListItem = ListItem&
The base class properties Expression and Multiline are hidden and ignored if set.
See the User's Guide for an overview of using this condition.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.CompareToStringsCondition.Items
member.summary: Items is the collection of strings which will be compared against the contents of the textbox. It can optionally be set by the , , and properties.

value.para: You must add at least one string to this collection although it really should have two or more strings because the CompareToValueCondition is better for comparing one string.
There are several ways to establish the contents of this list:

item.description: The Properties Editor supports a UITypeEditor for this property.
This property is a collection. Add a string by calling the Add method like this: Add("string value")
Establish the , , and properties then call the method. The automatically calls AppendDataSourceToItems() for you.

member.name: P:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.CompareToStringsCondition.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source that populates the property on the Owner's OnPreRender method.
member.value: Use this property to specify a source of data to populate the Items collection.

remarks.para: The items in the Items collection are initialized from and .

Unlike other controls, you do not need to call DataBind() on the control to convert your DataSource into Items. The automatically calls its method during OnPreRender. If you add this condition to any other validator or FieldStateController, you must call AppendDataSourceToItems() after setting up the DataSource and related properties.

value.para: If the DataSource contains more than one table, use this property to specify the exact table to bind to the control.
It defaults to "".

value.para: A string that specifies the field of the data source that provides the text content of the list items.

member.remarks: Use this property to specify a field in the to display as the items of the list in a list control.

member.name: T:Jenzabar.Portal.Framework.Web.UI.Controls.Validation.BaseIntMinMaxCondition
member.summary: BaseIntMinMaxCondition is a base class for classes that provide an integer minimum and maximum property.

remarks.para: It defines the properties and .
By default, Mimimum = 0 turns off minimum. Maximum = 0 turns off maximum. Override these properties to define alternative defaults and argument validation.
It handles the DescribeBody and DefineProperties methods.
It supports up to two controls to evaluate. The second is optional.
